## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey, I'm interested in moving some assets from the Verus blockchain to the Ethereum blockchain. Can you tell me how to do that, and what I should keep in mind when doing so?

**AI Assistant:**
Bridging assets from the Verus blockchain to the Ethereum blockchain allows you to move assets between the two chains. To do this, you need to use a bridge, which is a smart contract on the Ethereum side that enables the transfer of assets. When bridging, you need to pay gas fees on the Ethereum side to use the smart contract.

To get started, you'll want to estimate the bridging costs. You can do this using Verus Mobile or by running a command on your computer using the Verus CLI. The command is:
```json
run sendcurrency "*" '[{
  "currency":"veth",
  "exportto":"veth",
  "address":"0x71518580f36FeCEFfE0721F06bA4703218cD7F63",
  "amount":1,
  "refundto":"john doe@"
}]' 1 0.0001 1
```
Alternatively, you can use a `curl` command to estimate the bridging costs.

When running the command, make sure to keep the `1` at the end, or you will send the actual amount. The response will contain the fee you need to pay in VRSC to bridge from Verus to Ethereum.

The bridging process can take 30-60 minutes to complete. You can use Verus Mobile, Verus Desktop, or the Verus CLI to bridge your assets from Verus to Ethereum.

It's essential to consider a few things when bridging your assets. Firstly, gas fees on the Ethereum side can be expensive, so make sure you're prepared for that. Additionally, you should ensure you have sufficient VRSC to pay for the bridging fee.

Once you have estimated the bridging costs, you can proceed with the bridging process using Verus Mobile, Verus Desktop, or the Verus CLI.

Do you have any further questions about bridging assets from Verus to Ethereum, or would you like more information on any of the steps I mentioned?

# How to bridge from Verus to Ethereum
Bridge VRSC, ETH, DAI, MKR, Bridge.vETH and any other bridged assets from the Verus blockchain to the Ethereum blockchain.To bridge from Verus to Ethereum gas fees have to be paid to use the smart contract on the Ethereum side. It can be very expensive.You can estimate the bridging costs through Verus Mobile or if you are on a computer use the following command: (⚠️ KEEP THE `1` AT THE END OR YOU WILL SEND THE ACTUAL AMOUNT)``` json
run sendcurrency "*" '[{
  "currency":"veth",
  "exportto":"veth",
  "address":"0x71518580f36FeCEFfE0721F06bA4703218cD7F63",
  "amount":1,
  "refundto":"john doe@"
}]' 1 0.0001 1
```Or use:``` json
curl --location 'https://YOUR-API-SERVER' \
--header 'content-type: text/plain;' \
--data-raw '{
  "jsonrpc": "1.0",
  "id": "curltext",
  "method": "sendcurrency",
  "params": [
    "*",
    [
      {
        "currency": "veth",
        "exportto": "veth",
        "address": "0x71518580f36FeCEFfE0721F06bA4703218cD7F63",
        "amount": 1,
        "refundto": "john doe@"
      }
    ],
    1,
    0.0001,
    true
  ]
}'
```Then you look for the number after ``i5w5MuNik5NtLcYmNzcvaoixooEebB6MGV``, it is the fee you have to pay in VRSC to cross from Verus to Ethereum.⏱️ The bridging from Verus to Ethereum can take 30 - 60 mins.Learn how to go from Verus to Ethereum with [Verus Mobile](/eth-bridge/verus-to-ethereum.html#verus-mobile), [Verus Desktop](/eth-bridge/verus-to-ethereum.html#verus-desktop) or [CLI](/eth-bridge/verus-to-ethereum.html#cli).## Verus Mobile
To bridge over from Verus to Ethereum using Verus Mobile you can go to vETH (or DAI.vETH, MKR.vETH, VRSC or other bridged assets). Then click on "Send", then "Convert or Cross-chain", then "Send off-chain".
